title: Fuel Pump Assembly - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
Before disconnecting any fuel lines, make sure the engine and exhaust system has cooled down.
Failure to follow the advice above could risk a fire, which could result in serious injury or death.
The fuel pump and fuel filter assembly is a sealed for life unit and must be replaced as a unit.
Use proprietary professional automotive workshop equipment approved for fuel handling to drain the fuel from the fuel tank.
Fuel; Pump and Level Sensor Removal - LG2; LK2
The fuel pump and level sensor are removed as an assembly.
Invert the fuel tank and place it on a protective surface to prevent paint damage.
Remove the fixings that attach the fuel pump mounting plate to the fuel tank.
Lift the fuel pump and fuel level sensor assembly and manoeuvre it from the fuel tank aperture.
Noting its orientation, remove and discard the sealing ring from the fuel pump assembly.

Battery - Removal

Fuel Tank - Removal
The fuel pump and level sensor are removed as an assembly.
Invert the fuel tank and place it on a protective surface to prevent paint damage.
Remove the fixings that attach the fuel pump mounting plate to the fuel tank.

Lift the fuel pump and fuel level sensor assembly and manoeuvre it from the fuel tank aperture.
